title: Lonzell Hill
data: Lonzell Ramon Hill (born September 25, 1965) is an American former professional football player who was a wide receiver for four seasons in the National Football League (NFL) for the New Orleans Saints. He was selected by the Saints in the second round of the 1987 NFL draft.[1] His father, J. D. Hill, also played wide receiver in the NFL. In 2007, Hill became the Salvation Army's social services director in Renton, Washington.[2] Prior to his position in Renton, he was the youth director at the Seattle YMCA. Later on, Hill became a youth interim director at the YMCA in Cincinnati.[3] This biographical article relating to an American football wide receiver born in the 1960s is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
